This is an interesting game, I've been watching gameplays since the beginning of this being out. However, I've only started playing it shortly. Like many have mentioned, this game has no tutorial, save for few hints as you wait for the match to load. So unless you have a friend to explain every aspect of the game, expect to be sacrificed quite a bit until you get the hang of it. 

The balance for matchmaking is ridiculous, and not in a good sense. You could be starting out in the game, trying to learn how to hide and escape, and you face a rank one pro killer. Basically meaning you have no chance of winning. This is something to fix. Another thing is sensitivity to do actions. If two items are too close to each other, you have to be super careful in order to achieve the action you actually want. 

Besides these two items, this game is actually very entertaining with friends. This is not something I'd want to play alone, even though it seems fun, for the sake of communication. If you play with friends, you can definitely communicate where killers, generators, and totems are. Which is extremely crucial as you discover in your gameplay. Without this, it becomes extremely difficult, but still worth the challenge - if you want to play alone. 

Another thing to note, and even though this is a tactic it's not one I particular enjoy (frankly it's horrible and I want it addressed), killers being campers. The game is much more entertaining if you don't camp the survivors because it keeps everyone on their toes. However, if you camp, we will literally leave the killer and the poor victim alone to complete the objectives and escape. What does this mean? One survivor, one player, ends up frustrated at the lack of gameplay and terrible match. I've been victim to this quite a bit and though my friends and I tried different tactics to survive this sort of killer - it always ends with someone else (if not the original victim) being killed. This needs to be fixed or there should be a penalty for camping. 

So new players, beware. And I mean BEWARE. Even though it is fun after you get the hang of it, all these issues will drive people away unless there are friends asking you to play.

While i did not play too much with this game it is pretty obvious that in its current state, this game is very unbalanced, with only a few viable killers. Killers are underpowered and handicapped. While survivors have a lot of useful perks and tools at their disposal, killers feel lackluster. When playing less viable killers it feels like a grotesque Benny Hill Show. Even agains moderately skilled survivors you can grab 1-2 kills at best, if you camp hard. While camping is not against the rules, and even the game mechanisms encourages you to do so, you will always get blamed for it. 

There is 3 scenario for killers: 
1) camp and get 1-2 kills and the hateful comments of the survivors after the match
2) do not camp, and get nothing in return, not a single kill
3) you get 3-4 kills and/or win (in this scenario you can assume that all of the survivors are probably idiots, noobs or heavily handicapped in some way, and it is definetly not because of your skill).

None of the 3 scenarios fill you with hapiness or a sense of accomplishment so don't bother playing Killers. Even if you do so, pick nurse, billy, huntress or maybe shape.

Kinda regret buying this game even for a discounted price, and will definetly not buy any dlcs.

Es el pilla pilla y el escondite pero para adultos, con clásicos del terror como Myers o Krueger. 

El trasfondo por lo que he podido deducir es que hay una especie de demonio al que llaman 'El Ente' el cual ostenta una fabrica de pallets y se dedica a repartirlos por un mapa generado aleatoriamente en cada partida para tocarle la moral al asesino, mientras 4 señores con linternas o cajas de herramientas corretean por aquí y por allí mientras se los lanzan a la cara y reparan generadores para abrir una puerta e irse.

Sinceramente; está de puta madre. ¿Lo recomiendo? Bueno, hay que tener paciencia con el título y pensar que es una compañía pequeña la que lo lleva. A cada parche que sale; normalmente algo se rompe, pero la verdad es que contenido no falta y los desarrolladores se lo curran muchísimo. Si te mola el género, o bien te van las pelis de Slasher y quieres vivir en tus carnes el momento en el que te giras y ves en una esquina a Michael Myers observándote, o simplemente quieres un juego competitivo, o un título para pasar un rato de vez en cuando con amigos y pegar/pegarte algún susto, está muy, pero que muy bien. 

No le quiero poner una nota, porque para mí puede ser un 9 de 10 y para otra persona puede ser un 4 o un 1, pero por menos de 10€ que se puede pillar en ofertas; es un título brutal que recomiendo muchísimo.

Ha inaugurato un genere, l'horror multiplayer asimmetrico a squadre, ma ciò nonostante non mi sento assolutamente di consigliarlo:
-il gioco è costantemente minato da problemi tecnici, ovvero hitbox ridicole,compenetrazione, bug sia in lobby che in game,item che non funzionano, etc..
-il gioco è sbilanciato a rotazione, ovvero ci sono periodi che i survivors sono onnipotenti e il killer non può far altro che imprecare e far la figura del piagnucolone ed altri periodi dove i killer sono così forti che o si gioca di premade oppure non se ne fa nulla....
-la community è marcia fino al midollo, in parte complici gli streamer e youtuber che approfittando dei problemi trattati ai punti precenti giocano e promuovono comportamenti scorretti e tossici.
-i developer non fanno nulla per risolvere i problemi più gravi presenti dagli albori del gioco, nonostante sia già alla patch 2.3 (al momento della stesura della recensione) , preferendo investire buona parte del loro budget nella creazione di skin a pagamento e non.
-Il giocatore che hosta la partita, ovvero il killer, fa da server quindi è frequentissimo avere problemi di lag , a volte volontari ma molto spesso voluti (Lagswitch).
-Per qualche strano motivo non si può mantenere il party a partita finita dovendo OGNI VOLTA re-invitare i propri amici per giocare insieme.
-Il rank system non offre assolutamente NESSUNA ricompensa, tanto da rendere inutile sforzarsi a rankare.

"You can run, but you can't hide, bitch."
That pretty sums up this game. 

You can play as a survivor (or not-survivor, see that?), repair generators, hide from scary as shit killer and... yea, that's it. 
But you can play as a killer who (obviously)  likes killing and hanging people. Doesn't sound entertaining? Well, it is. This is really great game in which you must think of yourself rather than others, there is surprisingly deep progression system. It could help you a bit, I personally think about it like a paper RPG in which you can have small buffs for your character rather than some extreme game changing perks. As you become more expert in this game, you start to make loadouts that in fact can change the gameplay.
